moa: Inhibits the conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II, causing vasodilation and reduction in the release of aldosterone.
Inhibits the influx of calcium ions into vascular smooth muscle and cardiac muscle, resulting in decreased peripheral vascular resistance and reduced blood pressure.
Selectively blocks the binding of angiotensin II to the AT1 receptor, preventing vasoconstriction and reducing the secretion of aldosterone.
Inhibits sodium reabsorption in the distal tubules causing increased excretion of sodium and water, as well as potassium and hydrogen ions.
Inhibits the reabsorption of sodium and chloride in the ascending loop of Henle and distal renal tubule.
Directly relaxes arteriolar smooth muscle, reducing peripheral vascular resistance.
Selectively blocks the binding of angiotensin II to the AT1 receptor, preventing vasoconstriction and reducing the secretion of aldosterone.
Selectively blocks the binding of angiotensin II to the AT1 receptor, preventing vasoconstriction and reducing the secretion of aldosterone.
Inhibits the conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II, causing vasodilation and reduction in the release of aldosterone.
Stimulates alpha-2 adrenergic receptors in the brainstem, reducing sympathetic outflow and decreasing blood pressure.
Inhibits the influx of calcium ions into vascular smooth muscle, leading to vasodilation and reduced heart rate.
Inhibits the influx of calcium ions into vascular smooth muscle, leading to vasodilation and reduced heart rate.
Selectively blocks beta1-adrenergic receptors in the heart and smooth muscle, decreasing heart rate and contractility.
Competes with aldosterone in the distal renal tubules, increasing sodium and water excretion while conserving potassium and hydrogen ions.
Inhibits sodium reabsorption in the distal tubules causing increased excretion of sodium and water, as well as potassium and hydrogen ions.
Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis and increasing LDL uptake from the blood.
Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis and increasing LDL uptake from the blood.
Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis and increasing LDL uptake from the blood.
Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis and increasing LDL uptake from the blood.
Activates peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor-alpha (PPAR-a), leading to lipolysis and elimination of triglyceride-rich particles.
Inhibits lipolysis in adipose tissue, reduces hepatic VLDL synthesis, and increases HDL levels.
Reduces hepatic triglyceride synthesis and increases plasma lipoprotein lipase activity.
Inhibits the absorption of cholesterol at the brush border of the small intestine.
Inhibits PCSK9 which degrades LDL receptors; increases the number of LDL receptors available to clear LDL.
Inhibits PCSK9 which degrades LDL receptors; increases the number of LDL receptors available to clear LDL.
Inhibits PCSK9 synthesis via RNA interference, leading to less LDL receptor breakdown and lower LDL levels.
Inhibits platelet activation and aggregation by irreversibly binding to the P2Y12 class of ADP receptors on platelets.
Reversibly binds to the P2Y12 ADP receptor on platelets, inhibiting platelet activation and aggregation.
Inhibits cyclooxygenase-1 (COX-1) and cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2), reducing the formation of thromboxane A2 and inhibiting platelet aggregation.
Relaxes vascular smooth muscle by increasing nitric oxide, leading to vasodilation.
Selectively blocks binding of angiotensin II to AT1 receptor, preventing vasoconstriction and reducing aldosterone secretion; inhibits neprilysin to induce vasodilation and natriuresis.
Converts plasminogen to plasmin, leading to the degradation of fibrin in thrombi.
